column8: Eastern N. America - New York to Minnesota, south to Florida and Oklahoma.
column15: Cacalia atriplicifolia L. is a synonym of Arnoglossum atriplicifolium (L.) H.Rob.
column16: Cacalia atriplicifolia is a PERENNIAL growing to 1.8 m (6ft).  It is in flower from July to September, and the seeds ripen from August to October. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Insects.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils. Suitable pH: mildly acid and neutral soils. It can grow in full shade (deep woodland) or  semi-shade (light woodland). It prefers  moist soil.
column18: Woodland Garden Dappled Shade; Shady Edge; not Deep Shade;
column20: Condiment: the various plants that are used as flavourings, either as herbs, spices or condiments.
column21: Young leaves - cooked[177]. Used as a potherb[183]. The powdered leaves are used as a seasoning[257].
column22: Poultice: A moist, usually warm or hot, mass of plant material applied to the skin in the treatment of burns etc.
column23: Plants For A Future can not take any responsibility for any adverse effects from the use of plants. Always seek advice from a professional before using a plant medicinally.PoulticeThe leaves have been used as a poultice for cuts, bruises and cancers, and also to draw out blood or poisonous materials[222, 257].
column25: A good food and shelter plant for beneficial organisms especially birds.
column27: We have very little information on this species and do not know if it will be hardy in Britain, though judging by its native range it should succeed outdoors in many parts of this country. The following notes are based on the general needs of the genus. Prefers a moist peaty or leafy lime-free soil in shade or semi-shade[200]. Plants tend to be somewhat invasive, they are best suited to naturalizing in the wild or woodland garden[200]. For polyculture design as well as the above-ground architecture (form - tree, shrub etc. and size shown above) information on the habit and root pattern is also useful and given here if available. The plant growth habit is a clumper with limited spread [1-2].
column28: Seed - we have no information on this species but suggest sowing the seed in spring in a cold frame. Surface sow or only just cover the seed and do not allow the compost to dry out. Prick out the seedlings into individual pots when they are large enough to handle and grow them on in light shade until they are large enough to plant out. Division in spring.
